channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rahm Emanuel, U.S. Envoy, Says His Impatience Nudged Japan Forward
item.description: In a society used to quiet consensus-building, Tokyo has made bold changes to its defense policy. “Did I contribute to that?” Mr. Emanuel asked. “Uh, ...

item.title: Trump taps Truth Social CEO to lead intelligence advisory board
item.description: Trump said Nunes will remain the chief executive of Truth Social while leading the advisory panel.

item.title: U.S. in Direct Contact With Rebels Who Took Over Syria
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said the United States was communicating directly with Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, the dominant rebel faction, despite ...

item.title: This Unreadable Russian Novel Drives Xi’s Struggle Against America
item.description: The Chinese leader is digging into the language of revolution, and a radical Russian novel, as he prepares for battle with Donald Trump.

item.title: Strategy of Recruiting Cheap Militiamen Backfires in Africa
item.description: By arming civilians who are poorly trained and have little to no respect for human rights, the military in Burkina Faso has brought the West African n...

item.title: Nancy Pelosi has hip replacement surgery at a US military hospital in Germany after falling at Battle of the Bulge ceremony
item.description: Pelosi, 84, “is well on the mend,” said Ian Krager, a spokesman for the California Democrat, in a statement.

item.title: The fall of Afghanistan’s horse power is a lesson to today’s petrostates: Power based on a strategic commodity is fleeting
item.description: Not so long ago, Afghanistan was the Saudi Arabia of horses. But technological change led to its rapid decline.

item.title: Trump Names Richard Grenell for ‘Special Missions’ Role
item.description: A combative loyalist and the president-elect’s former ambassador to Germany, Mr. Grenell had hoped to be secretary of state.

item.title: Strategy of Recruiting Cheap Militiamen Backfires in Africa

item.title: ‘They Had the Desire to Return’
item.description: Elated residents are trickling home to their shattered Syrian town, a rebel stronghold controlled until recently by the government.

item.title: ABC agrees to give $15 million to Donald Trump’s presidential library to settle defamation lawsuit
item.description: ABC will also pay $1 million in legal fees to Trump’s lawyer.

item.title: Trump and members of Congress want drones shot down while more are spotted near military facilities
item.description: The Pentagon said that the military’s initial assessment — that the drones are not of foreign origin — remains unchanged.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Chido Pummels French Territory Mayotte
item.description: The storm, the equivalent of a Category 4, was moving toward East Africa’s coast on Sunday after killing several people in Mayotte, a French archipela...

item.description: Elated residents are trickling home to their shattered Syrian town, a rebel stronghold controlled until recently by the government.
